data.title: German professional football player – Ilkay Gundogan
data.meta_description: Ilkay Gundogan - erudite midfield star, plays an important role at Manchester City and the German National Team, bringing creativity
data.text:
Ilkay Gundogan, the midfield pillar of Manchester City and the German National Team, overcame injury challenges to win many important titles in both the Bundesliga and Premier League. He is an important talent, bringing stability and creativity to his team. Together Rakhoi TV Learn about this talented player.

Player biography

Player biography Ilkay Gundogan

Although player Ilkay Gundogan has Turkish parents, he was born and raised in Gelsenkirchen, Nordrhein-Westfalen, Germany. This is the hometown of the Schalke 04 football team, which was the source of inspiration for player Ilkay Gundogan to develop his passion for football since he was a child.

Despite difficulties in his childhood and losing the opportunity to join the club, player Ilkay Gundogan’s dream of becoming a professional footballer never faded.

Currently, he has become a famous midfielder, contributing to Barcelona and the German national team. His success is a testament to his perseverance and relentless passion in his football career. .

Playing style of player Ilkay Gundogan

Playing style of player Ilkay Gundogan

Player Ilkay Gundogan is famous in the online football community as an excellent midfielder in world football. His talent comes not only from his physical strength but also from his leadership ability and creative vision.

Famous coach Jurgen Klopp praised Gundogan as a smart, comprehensive midfielder with many strengths.

Even though he started his career as a midfielder, Gundogan still shines when moved to a new position. Watching football online, fans clearly see his speed, dribbling technique and flexibility, especially in the role of defensive midfielder or center.

These qualities have contributed to building a famous name for player Ilkay Gundogan in the world of international football.

Football career journey of player Ilkay Gundogan

To reach today’s position, Gundogan overcame many difficulties in his football career. Rakhoi TV takes you to explore the challenging journey of the Turkish midfielder.

Football career journey of player Ilkay Gundogan

Club level

Despite missing out on his chance with Schalke 04, player Ilkay Gundogan started his career at VfL Bochum and joined FC Nurnberg in 2008.

Borussia Dortmund then bought him back, contributing to the Bundesliga and DFB Pokal double. Player Ilkay Gundogan also contributed to the team’s journey that brought them to the 2013 C1 Cup Final. In 2016, he moved to Manchester City for a fee of 21 million pounds, winning the Premier League for 4 consecutive years.

Now, he moved to Barcelona, ​​continuing to highlight his name and attract attention from the community because of the diversity and success of his career.

International arena level

After spending time with youth teams, in 2011, Gundogan proved his class when he was called up to the German team. On his debut, he replaced Philipp Lahm in the UEFA Euro 2012 qualifiers.

Despite many challenges with health and injuries, Gundogan is still favored.

Fans watching live football see him continuously appear in the squads attending major events such as Euro 2012, FIFA WC 2018, Euro 2020 and FIFA WC 2022, marking his stability and influence in the team. German national team shirt.

Outstanding achievements of Ilkay Gundogan

Player Gundogan, admired by Jurgen Klopp, is described as an “intelligent and well-rounded midfielder with countless strengths”. His good attitude and eagerness to learn helped him overcome difficulties in Dortmund and achieve success.

Up to now, Gundogan has had an impressive journey with clubs. Starting from VfL Bochum II, 1. FC Nurnberg, Borussia Dortmund to Manchester City, he has shown variety and success with 303 appearances and 60 goals.

In the international environment, Gundogan played 66 matches and scored 17 goals for the German National Team, under the coaching of top coaches such as Pep Guardiola, Jurgen Klopp and Thomas Tuchel.

He also revealed his consideration of becoming a coach after ending his football career.
